conclusion: Block P has mass m and initial velocity v0. Block Q has mass 4m and is initially at rest.
The total momentum before the collision is mv0. Let vP1 and vQ1 be the velocities of P and Q immediately after the collision. The total momentum after the collision is mvP1 + 4mvQ1.
Using conservation of momentum: v0 = vP1 + 4vQ1 (Equation 1)
The total kinetic energy before the collision is (1/2)mv0^2. The total kinetic energy after the collision is (1/2)mvP1^2 + (1/2)(4m)vQ1^2.
Using conservation of kinetic energy: v0^2 = vP1^2 + 4vQ1^2 (Equation 2)
Substitute vQ1 back into Equation 1: vP1 = v0 - 4(2/5)v0
The velocity of P immediately after the first collision is vP1 = -(3/5)v0.
The velocity of Q immediately after the first collision is vQ1 = (2/5)v0.
